1.heading: Van.
1.title: "The Atomic Man
1.author: by Van
1.appears_in: p. 4-5 in Comic Art News & Reviews, v. 1, no. 5 (Dec. 1973).
notes: Begins an unpublished Canadian comic book story "from the era of the Canadian whites," cf. Comic Art News & Reviews no. 4.

3.heading: Van Pools.
3.title: "Honey, I Think Lawn Care Before Work Might Be Too Stimulating"
3.author: by Nicole Hollander.
notes: Summary: Speculation about specialized van pools (dating van for singles, lawn care van for marrieds) to ease traffic congestion.

4.title: "Van Williams" p. 42-65 in David Anthony Kraft's Comics Interview, no. 124
4.author: [No author]
notes: Interview of the actor who played The Green Hornet. Interviewer is Dave Galvan.

5.heading: Vana.
5.title: "Overgrown Germs from Saturn"
5.author: E
5.appears_in: C. Stoner. 6 p. in Popular Comics, no. 66 (Aug. 1941).
notes: Summary: Martan and Vana free a farm family from white spheres surrounding their farmhouse.

6.heading: Vana, Al.
6.title: "Two Deaths to Die!" 1 p. in The Unseen, no. 11
6.author: [No author]
notes: After his execution, "Al Vana, a Chicago hood," is brought back to life by the underworld so they can shoot him for squealing.

7.heading: Vanak, Joseph.
7.title: Red Cartoons of 1927 from the Daily Worker and the Workers Monthly

notes: Cover title: Red cartoons 1927.
Political cartoons.

9.heading: Vanam.
9.title: "The Blind Death"
9.author: art: Lee Elias
9.appears_in: 6 p. in Planet Comics, no. 24 (May 1943) ; reprinted in Planet Comics, no. 65 (1951).
notes: Apperances of Viceroy of Vanam, Capt. Saracen; villain Marto is introduced.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

10.heading: Vanam.
10.title: "Captured by the Cliff Men"
10.author: pencils: Al Schwartz? ; inks: Harry Sahle? 7 p
notes: Appearance of Jack North, Queen of Vanam; villains are a Lion Man, King Yurk, and the Cliff Men (all introduced here and die).
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

11.heading: Vanam.
11.title: "Zang the Exile"
11.author: art: Saul Rosen
notes: Appearance of Jack North; villian Zang is introduced and dies; introducton of the Queen of Vanam.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

12.heading: Vanam City.

notes: Villain Capt. Saracen is introduced; introduction of the Viceroy of Vanam City.
Data from Lou Mougin via the Grand Comics Database Project.

(Pastiches & Parodies (1))

Article on the album Kuifje in El Salvador, created to look like a Tintin album by using mainly recycled panels from Hergé's own work for a story denouncing U.S. and multinational corporate support of the Salvadoran regime.

45.heading: Van Belle, Anita--Miscellanea.
45.title: "Quelle Critique pour la Bande Dessinée?" p. 52-55 in Les Cahiers de la Bande Dessinée, no. 63
45.author: [No author]
notes: (Théoriques)

Transcribes a round table discussion among members of the magazine's staff, on the state of Franco-Belgian comics criticism. Participants are: Jacques Samson, Thierry Smolderen, Thierry Groensteen, Claude Ecken, Bruno Lecigne, Arnaud de la Croix, and Sylvain Bouyer. Photographs are included of Pierre Sterckx, Smolderen, Anita Van Belle, De la Croix, Daniel Hugues, Groensteen, Lecigne, and Bouyer.
